author: jochembrouwer
content:
Hi <@275684146658148352> I have another EIP3540/EIP3670 question regarding this test:
EOF1_Execution_d12g0v0_London+3540+3670

This calls into a contract with this code:
`ef000101000d020067006001600657fe5b600160005500ffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff`

The container length is 128 bytes. The header is valid. The code size is 0x000d (13) and the data section size is 0x0067 (103). So, in this case the container size should be 10 + 13 + 103 = 126 which is not the code length of 128 bytes. However, when generating the tests, the reported test output specifically notes that the called contract (0x174f5374fce5edbc8e2a8697c15331677e6ebf0b - this has the bytecode of above) should run. The storage slot 0 is empty before running the transaction, but puts 1 post-transaction (so the code is valid and has ran). 

What am I missing here? The container length and the expected length do not seem to match, yet the code still runs..?
